page.title: 12CUSTOMS
page.content:
{MAY DAY}BY MARK LYSONS
Every year at Sheriffhales School we have a May Day. We do this because we are keeping up an old custom which is the celebration of all the things coming back to life after the winter chill. At May Day some children dance round our May Pole. The third year and fourth year juniors do the May Pole dance. The first and second year juniors do country dancing which comes first. We have some stalls most of them are game stalls. We do about six dances around the May Pole. One is called the Barbers Pole where the boys go nearer to the pole than the girls then the girls skip round the polein a circle until the music changes then the boys skip round in a smaller circle until the music changes and so on.
